Compact cyclotron CV28 operating in a
pulsed mode with 1 ns pulse duration and aprx. 1 MHz
repetition rate. Deuterons of 4.1 to 12.3 MeV were
directed on a deuterium gas target. Typical beam
ERR-T heading in percent changed to DATA-ERR - S.M.
MONITOR and MONIT-REF lines were moved in proper
Vienna, Austria  was deleted because does not contain
Comments of W.Mannnhart were added in COVARIANCE and
U-238 MONITOR lines were moved in ASSUMED .
Correction of errors was done according to comment of
N.Otsuka (NDS,IAEA) - only two coded errors have to be
given - ERR-T and ERR-1 (as fully correclated part of
Entry was sent 29.06.2012 to author Wolf Mannhart
to approve. Reply 30.06.2012: "I will respond as soon
as I have checked the details".
.After subtraction of the GAS-OUT measurements from
the measured data, corrections were applied for the
breakup neutrons. The magnitude of the correction
depends on the reaction cross section and on the
neutron energy. The error of the correction is 3% of
the experimental value (R) describing the actual
For summing losses in the photon counting

For photon attenuation in the sample

The fully correlated portion of the uncertainty is
given as ERR-1 and enables, in combination with the
ERR-T values, the generation of the complete
Off-diagonal elements of monitor cross sections are
treated as negligible (i.e., treated as uncorrelated)
because one considers the magnitude of the relative
covariance from the monitor cross sections is usually
small compared with the relative covariance from the
The covariance matrix of the primary cross section
ratios is therefore obtained by subtracting a certain
uncertainty component of monitor cross section from
the "diagonal" elements of the constructed matrix.
The magnitude of this component is 1.5% (independent
on the neutron energy) for the 238U(n,f) monitor and
For measurements of the radioactivity of the
irradiated samples. Volume 300 cm3, normal effici-
ency 70%. Detector calibrated with a series of
U-238 fission chamber for neutron fluence
monitoring via FF - for U-238 monitor
Error of the neutron energy scale   - 20 keV
Compact cyclotron CV28 operating in a
pulsed mode with 1 ns pulse duration and aprx. 1 MHz
repetition rate. Deuterons of 4.1 to 12.3 MeV were
directed on a deuterium gas target. Typical beam
Target is deuterium gas in a cell 3 cm long
and 1 cm in diameter pressurized to 200 kPA
.Neutron energy resolution is between 100 and 130 keV,
For neutron energy determination, flight path
Each irradiation was accompanied by a separate
measurement with an empty gas cell to compensate for
low-energy neutrons generated in the materials of the
The neutron fluence was monitored by means of a
by means of two aluminum  foils in a sandwich geometry.
Only in the case of the 27Al(n,a) monitor with a
maximum breakup correction of about 10% a direct
renormalization of the data is possible in a good
approximation. However for the 238U(n,f) monitor the
direct renormalization delivers a wrong result. If
one studies Figs. 1 and 2 of C,88MITO,p1025, one
will recognize that more than one half of the
counted 238U(n,f) events in the experiment results
from the low-energy neutrons of the D(d,np) reaction
in the case of a primary neutron energy of 14 MeV.

and detector calibration. The remaining errors are
from the subtraction of the separate GAS-OUT measure-
ments, from the correction of the breakup neutrons
